result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Lee Gee

defendant.name: Gee, Christopher Lee
defendant.address: Green Bay Correctional Institution 2833 Riverside, Green Bay, WI 54301

records.addlTxt: Tried to schedule zoom with Green Bay Correctional. They called back and said he was transferred to another facility. Called and left a vm to set up zoom with that facility.

Assistant District Attorney Jessica Gereau appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Christopher Lee Gee not in court. Defendant was supposed to appear in person as the State prepared a writ. Defendant refused a covid test so was unable to be transported and GBCI could not accommodate zoom. Court finds good cause to exceed time limits. 
Present bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with J.E.S. or their residence or place of employment.
Emailed SPD and asked them to contact defendant to see if he qualifies for public defender.  Advised of date and time of PH.  - JE

Defendant Christopher Lee Gee appeared by video, in custody.  
Prosecuting attorney Jill A Engel in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Initial appearance on October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
